messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] parenting, was sigh
messages.messageBody:
<<I don't know, maybe you'd have just been older. I became a Mom at 26, and
while I personally matured a lot between 20 and 26, I don't think my
parenting would have benn much different 6 years earlier. Tim's been a big
help in that learning curve!>>


I became a mom the first time at the age of 27, and it was tough for me. The
second time around I was 37 and the difference was unbelievable. Third child
I was 38 and the 4th child I was 42. I just kept getting better and better
at it. I honestly think if I would have waited longer the first time around,
I wouldn't have made so many mistakes. Then again, maybe it was
circumstances too. Who can know for sure?

Mary B

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] parenting, was sigh
messages.msgSnippet: ... Ren, I don t know, maybe you d have just been older.  I became a Mom at 26, and I while I personally matured a lot between 20 and 26, I don t think my
messages.messageBody:
10/25/02 05:24:

> I became a Mom at 20, and really feel I would have been a much better Mom if
> I'd been older!

Ren,

I don't know, maybe you'd have just been older. I became a Mom at 26, and I
while I personally matured a lot between 20 and 26, I don't think my
parenting would have benn much different 6 years earlier. Tim's been a big
help in that learning curve!

brenda
